item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-md-6"][cz_image tilt="on" id="cz_49743" image="1299" sk_css="margin-right:30px;border-style:solid;border-left-width:10px;border-color:#758bfd;box-shadow:0px 10px 50px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);" sk_css_tablet="margin-right:0px;"][/cz_image][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-md-6"][cz_gap height="25px" id="cz_16442"][cz_title smart_fs="true" text_center="true" id="cz_83623" sk_overall="margin-bottom:40px;" sk_overall_tablet="margin-top:80px;" sk_overall_mobile="margin-top:30px;margin-bottom:20px;" cz_title=""]

About Our Book Shop

[/cz_title][cz_title text_center="true" id="cz_33117" sk_overall="margin-bottom:30px;"]A company is a separate legal entity and can incur debt, sue and be sued. The company’s shareholders (the owners) can limit their personal liability and are generally not responsible for company debts. A company is a complex business structure and has high set-up and reporting costs. You can form a company as either a private (also known as proprietary) or public entity. A registered company must have at least one director (and a company secretary unless it is a private company)[/cz_title][cz_gap height="55px" id="cz_16442" height_mobile="5px"][cz_stylish_list icon_hover_fx="cz_sl_icon_hover_zoom_out_fade" id="cz_101369" items="%5B%7B%22title%22%3A%22Limited%20liability%22%2C%22icon_type%22%3A%22icon%22%7D%2C%7B%22title%22%3A%22Well%20understood%22%2C%22icon_type%22%3A%22icon%22%7D%2C%7B%22title%22%3A%22Able%20to%20raise%20significant%22%2C%22icon_type%22%3A%22icon%22%7D%2C%7B%22title%22%3A%22Offset%20against%20profits%22%2C%22icon_type%22%3A%22icon%22%7D%2C%7B%22title%22%3A%22Easy%20to%20sell%20ownership%22%2C%22icon_type%22%3A%22icon%22%7D%2C%7B%22title%22%3A%22Profits%20can%20be%20reinvested%22%2C%22icon_type%22%3A%22icon%22%7D%5D" default_icon="fa czico-104-tick" sk_icons="color:#ffffff;background-color:#758bfd;padding:3px;border-radius:100px;" sk_lists="width:47%;margin-right:3%;margin-bottom:15px;float:left;RTLfloat:right; margin-right:0px;margin-left:3%;RTL" sk_icons_hover="background-color:#242424;box-shadow:0px 10px 50px rgba(0,0,0,0.09);" sk_lists_mobile="width:100%;margin-right:0px;margin-left:0px;" cz_stylish_list=""][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][cz_gap height="150px" id="cz_16442" height_tablet="75px" height_mobile="50px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" video_bg="yes" video_bg_url="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pX6j0sDdDZc" css=".vc_custom_1562169090047{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;background-color: #242424 !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1545822745354{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}"][cz_gap height="100px" id="cz_12130" height_tablet="75px" height_mobile="40px"][cz_title smart_fs="true" text_center="true" id="cz_91609" cz_title=""]

The independent bookshop, traditional values

We Lose Ourselves in Books, We Find Ourselves There, Too

[/cz_title][cz_gap height="120px" id="cz_31871" height_tablet="75px" height_mobile="50px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1632336653264{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1545822745354{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}"][cz_gap height="100px" id="cz_12130" height_tablet="75px" height_mobile="70px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-md-4"][cz_testimonials arrow="cz_testimonials_bottom_arrow" arrow_background="#758bfd" id="cz_55443" sk_content="color:#ffffff;background-color:#758bfd;border-radius:40px 40px 40px 0;RTLborder-radius:40px 40px 0 40px;RTL" avatar="1166" sk_avatar="box-shadow:0px 10px 50px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);"]"Success is not final; failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts."[/cz_testimonials][cz_gap height="40px" id="cz_31871"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-md-4"][cz_testimonials name="Lisa Martines" subname="Housewife" arrow="cz_testimonials_bottom_arrow" arrow_background="#758bfd" id="cz_45246" sk_content="color:#ffffff;background-color:#758bfd;border-radius:40px 40px 40px 0;RTLborder-radius:40px 40px 0 40px;RTL" avatar="1146" sk_avatar="box-shadow:0px 10px 50px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);" sk_content_hover="0"]"Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do. Don't wish it were easier"[/cz_testimonials][cz_gap height="40px" id="cz_31871"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-md-4"][cz_testimonials name="Mike Nelson" subname="Web Developer" arrow="cz_testimonials_bottom_arrow" arrow_background="#758bfd" id="cz_22164" sk_content="color:#ffffff;background-color:#758bfd;border-radius:40px 40px 40px 0;RTLborder-radius:40px 40px 0 40px;RTL" avatar="1160" sk_avatar="box-shadow:0px 10px 50px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);" sk_content_hover="0"]"I owe my success to having listened respectfully to the very best advice, and then going away"[/cz_testimonials][cz_gap height="40px" id="cz_31871" height_mobile="0px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][cz_gap height="80px" id="cz_31871" height_tablet="60px" height_mobile="70px"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

In the beautiful surroundings of Upcote Farm in Cheltenham, 2000 Trees festival is a gem of a find if you’ve been lucky enough…I found this festival in 2008 when ‘Reuben’ were due to headline, but even though they disbanded a few weeks prior to the festival, us fans still decided to turn up, and boy am I glad I did… Being a small sized 5000 capacity festival, but not enough to have 20 minute waits at the bars and toilets. The balance between atmosphere and accessibility is second to none. The food stalls are all hand picked, the same with the local ciders/ales and beers, the organisers have really nailed it on the head, you can tell they themselves are, as well as bringing in some big names, it really does cater for every type music fan. In the beautiful surroundings of Upcote Farm in Cheltenham, 2000 Trees festival is a gem of a find if you’ve been lucky enough…I found this festival in 2008 when ‘Reuben’ were due to headline, but even though they disbanded a few weeks prior to the festival, us fans still decided to turn up, and boy am I glad I did… Being a small sized 5000 capacity festival, but not enough to have 20 minute waits at the bars and toilets. The balance between atmosphere and accessibility is second to none. The food stalls are all hand picked, the same with the local ciders/ales and beers, the organisers have really nailed it on the head, you can tell they themselves are, as well as bringing in some big names, it really does cater for every type music fan.
